name: SearchAuditLogs
description:
Retrieve audit logs events based on a search query.

Use this tool to filter and search through Datadog audit logs events using complex queries. Results are paginated.

parameters.name: minimum_time
parameters.description: Minimum time for the requested events. Accepts date, math, or timestamps in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Minimum time for the requested events. Supports date, math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: audit_logs_search_query
parameters.description: A string representing the search query following the Audit Logs search syntax to filter the logs.

value_schema.description: Search query following the Audit Logs search syntax.

parameters.name: maximum_time_for_requested_events
parameters.description: Maximum time for the requested events. Supports date, math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

value_schema.description: Maximum time for the requested events. Supports date, math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: time_offset_seconds
parameters.description: Time offset in seconds to apply to the query, adjusting the timeframe of the log search.

value_schema.description: Time offset (in seconds) to apply to the query.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone for the query, using GMT, UTC, an offset like UTC+1, or a Timezone Database identifier like America/New_York.

value_schema.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for retrieving subsequent pages of audit log results.

value_schema.description: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query.

parameters.name: max_events_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of events to include in the response, enabling efficient pagination.

value_schema.description: Maximum number of events in the response.

parameters.name: sort_parameter
parameters.description: Sort events by timestamp. Use 'timestamp' for ascending, '-timestamp' for descending.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: filter.from
parameters.description: Minimum time for the requested events. Supports date, math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

value_schema.description: Minimum time for the requested events. Supports date, math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: filter.query
parameters.description: Search query following the Audit Logs search syntax.

value_schema.description: Search query following the Audit Logs search syntax.

parameters.name: filter.to
parameters.description: Maximum time for the requested events. Supports date, math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

value_schema.description: Maximum time for the requested events. Supports date, math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: options.time_offset
parameters.description: Time offset (in seconds) to apply to the query.

value_schema.description: Time offset (in seconds) to apply to the query.

parameters.name: options.timezone
parameters.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

value_schema.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

parameters.name: page.cursor
parameters.description: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query.

value_schema.description: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query.

parameters.name: page.limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of events in the response.

value_schema.description: Maximum number of events in the response.
